title: Ferriswheel Entertainment to organise Worldfest 2015 in Mumbai
text:
Other Articles Spicy fare & spicier tales from chef Imtiaz Qureshi A war revisited The magic of dum Ferriswheel Entertainment is all set to organise Worldfest 2015 in Mumbai from December 18-20, 2015. More than 20 countries namely Ghana, Gabon, Madagascar, Romania, Sweden, South Africa, Jordan, Senegal, Taiwan and Norway among others will participate in this annual festival. These countries will showcase a magnificent concoction of country specific performances in the dance, culture and music categories along with handpicked unique artifacts from various corners of the globe. They will also showcase an array of authentic country specific cuisines cooked by the locals.
Elaborating about this exclusive cultural festival in India, Shubhra Bhardwaj , founder and creative director, Ferriswheel Entertainment said, “Everyone is leading a hectic life these days which is why people are opening up to travel. With over 20 countries performing and more than 72 hours of complete entertainment, Worldfest 2015 is going to be bigger and better this year. We are expecting an average footfall of more than 50,000 people at this one-of-its-kind international travel and tourism festival in India.”
Worldfest 2015 is a grand international performing arts, travel and tourism festival that attempts to bring the world together in one place. Not only does the festival provide a complete experiential zone teeming with art and culture, food, handicrafts but also offers an opportunity for first hand interactions with natives from various participating countries.
Worldfest 2015 is a celebration of life, color and music from different cultures and aims at promoting India as tourist friendly and safe destination. Worldfest 2015 hopes to create global citizens by uniting the youth of today as one people, enriched by individual differences and united by the common thread of humanity.
 08, 2015 5:32 pm
